description.narrative: In Phase A Terre des Hommes completed a research study on child labour in the mica supply chain in Madagascar. In Phase B they intend to develop a child protection programme related to end the worst forms of child labour in the mica supply chain in Madagascar. In addition, they will work with downstream actors. The research will be used to identify and engage companies and other relevant stakeholders in the supply chain in the Netherlands, Europe and beyond, with the aim to make the mica supply chain transparent and identify and implement ways to mitigate the risks and reduce the exploitation of children and advance their rights. Phase A encompasses research into the Madagascar mica supply chain, including its socio-economic context and recommendations to mitigate the negative impact. The launch of the report led to broad media coverage and presentation at international fora, which is still continuing. Phase B will be the kicked off to achieve multi-stakeholder engagement within Madagascar and with downstream companies to mitigate risks that will lead to long-term improved socio-economic conditions for children and their families around mica mining areas.The FBK mica project Madagascar is the starting point and platform based on which both Malagasy government actors and businesses upstream and other national and international CSOs and donors are engaged to improve the status quo around mica mining communities. This will go beyond the mining activities and the supply chain and extend to increase alternative livelihoods, access to social services and child protection issues. Businesses, both up- and downstream, will either through positive or negative incentives become engaged to mitigate supply chain risks. Currently, processes to this effect are already taking place in Madagascar and beyond.
